title: Introduction of analytical modules
text: Data format SCRS zip file: Raman spectrum dataset stored .txt file two columns: first column indicates Raman shift frequency points, second column indicates Raman intensity. Prior uploading, Raman spectrum data compressed zip archive, may include subdirectories. imperative avoid duplicate file names .txt files, compressed package exclusively contain Raman spectrum data without unrelated .txt files. Metadata tsv file: TSV file format, header first column “ID_Cell” store filenames Raman spectroscopy files without .txt extension. Options: Interpolation: Raman spectra interpolated integer frequencies. Notes: Cosmic rays eliminated spectral uploading immediately interpolation (interpolation option chosen). Interpolation becomes essential spectral files align Raman shift frequencies. Load RamEx data RamanD2O RamEx interoperable; users can choose import RamEx’s Ramanome object (stored RDS format) RamanD2O.

title: Introduction of analytical modules
text: Sample Raman spectra subsampled randomly retain specific percentage. Trim Raman spectra trimmed retain specific wavelength ranges . Smooth enhanced signal--noise ratio (SNR), Raman spectrum undergo smoothing process. RamanD2O incorporates three smoothing methods: LOESS: LOESS (locally weighted smoothing), non-parametric strategies fitting smooth curve data points. SG: Savitzky–Golay (SG) filtering, widely used method, involves local least-squares fitting data using polynomials. commonly employed smoothing data calculating derivatives noisy datasets. EMD: Denoising empirical mode decomposition (EMD) thresholding. Please refer emddenoise detailed descriptions. Caution: time-consuming!!! Baseline Two methods baseline removal implemented RamanD2O. polyfit: Polynomial baseline fitting. please refer spc_fit_poly spc_fit_poly detailed descriptions. als: Asymmetric Least Squares. please refer baseline.als detailed descriptions. Notes: Following baseline removal, Raman intensities may exhibit negative values. negative values can reset zero selecting “Set zero”, entire Raman spectra can vertically adjusted choosing “Pull ”. Normalize Raman spectra can normalized based area within specific wavelength range. “Fingerprint” checkbox chosen, normalization conducted within wavelength range 500 2000 cm-1; otherwise, entire spectrum utilized. Average average Raman spectra computed based selected metadata categories. SNR two calculation methods signal--noise ratio (SNR). new: SNR=max((2800−3050))−sum((1730−1800))length(1730−1800)sd((1730−1800))SNR=\frac{\frac{max((2800-3050))-sum((1730-1800))}{length(1730-1800)}}{sd((1730-1800))} old: SNR=max((1400−1460))−sum((1760−1790))length(1760−1790)sd((1760−1790))SNR=\frac{\frac{max((1400-1460))-sum((1760-1790))}{length(1760-1790)}}{sd((1760-1790))} Quality controlled using SNR: Low-quality spectra removed according SNR “Remove Low-SNR Spectra” selected. CDR CDR refers ratio Raman spectrum area C-D region sum C-D C-H regions, .e., CDR=area(C−D)area(C−D)+area(C−H)CDR=\frac{area(C-D)}{area(C-D) + area(C-H)}. C-D intensity region: 2050~2300 cm-1 C-H intensity region: 2800~3050 cm-1 Two metadata columns (CDR D2O) appended calculation. “CDR” column stores CDR values spectrum; “D2O” column store whether C-D peak exist (1) (0).

title: Introduction of analytical modules
text: Export data generated Raman spectra metadata can exported CSV, ZIP, RamEx format subsequent analysis. Visualization Raman spectra various processing steps can visualized compared interactively.

title: Introduction of analytical modules
text: Raman spectra data can analyzed using multivariable statistics (PCA, LDA MCR-ALS).

title: Introduction of analytical modules
text: Raman spectra can used various classification tasks. RamanD2O supply functions build test random forest models. Prepare Raman spectra can splitted train/eval/test datasets. Specific wavelength region can used features. Explore modeling, splitted datasets can visualized using t-SNE. Random forest randomForest implements Breiman’s random forest algorithm (based Breiman Cutler’s original Fortran code) classification regression. RandomForestClassifier trained using bootstrap aggregation, new tree fit bootstrap sample training observations. --bag (OOB) error average error observation calculated using predictions trees contain observation respective bootstrap sample. allows RandomForestClassifier fit validated whilst trained.

title: Introduction of analytical modules
text: Ramanome & Transcriptome O2PLS algorithm implemented integrate Ramanome datasets transcriptome datasets. Ramanome & Metabolome TBD. Multi-omics integration TBD.
